verses.verse_html: 1Then Job answered and said,

verses.text_plain: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
verses.verse_html:
2Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning. ▼
▼ stroke: Heb. hand

verses.text_plain: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!
verses.verse_html: 3Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!

verses.text_plain: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.verse_html: 4I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

verses.text_plain: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.
verses.verse_html: 5I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.

verses.text_plain: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
verses.verse_html: 6Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.

verses.text_plain: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
verses.verse_html: 7There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.

tokens.text: with him; so should I be delivered

verses.text_plain: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
verses.verse_html: 8Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

verses.text_plain: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:
verses.verse_html: 9On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:

verses.text_plain: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
verses.verse_html:
10But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold. ▼
▼ that…: Heb. that is with me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that…: Heb. that is with me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that…: Heb. that is with me

verses.text_plain: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
verses.verse_html: 11My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.

verses.text_plain: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.verse_html:
12Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food. ▼
▼ esteemed: Heb. hid, or, laid up
 , ▼
▼ my…: or, my appointed portion

footnotes.body_text: ▼ esteemed: Heb. hid, or, laid up
footnotes.body_html: ▼ esteemed: Heb. hid, or, laid up
▼ my…: or, my appointed portion

verses.text_plain: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
verses.verse_html: 13But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.

verses.text_plain: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.
verses.verse_html: 14For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.

verses.text_plain: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
verses.verse_html: 15Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.

verses.text_plain: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
verses.verse_html: 16For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:

verses.text_plain: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.
verses.verse_html: 17Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.

tokens.text: Because I was not cut off
